poem:
### The Lament of the Line

In the blur of feathers and steel,  
where time is not measured by clocks  
but by the rhythm of pain,  
what value has flesh  
ground to the pulse of profit?  
The silent cry of a grinder  
drowns in the rivers of sweat—  
each cut a question left unanswered.  
In speed, humanity falters.
